intro: Cestichis calcarea, commonly known as the limestone cestichis, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its structure includes a short stem with a basal rosette of leaves, and it produces umbels of flowers that bloom in the spring. Cestichis calcarea is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
